An important concept to remember is that compounding is the process that takes a present valuation of
money to some point in the future, while discounting takes a future value of money and equates it to present
dollar value terms.
Common applications in which you might use the present value formula include determining how much

for your oldest child and how much you would need to invest today to meet your retirement plans 30 years
